title: How to Delete a Program Completely by Modifying the Registry (Windows)

steps.title: Completely uninstall the program you want to get rid of.
steps.content: Completely uninstall the program you want to get rid of.

steps.title: Get rid of the registry items pointing to that program next.
steps.content: Get rid of the registry items pointing to that program next.

steps.title: Go to Regedit.exe.
steps.content: Go to Regedit.exe. You can use the run program in the start menu.

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export. (In Win98 and WinME this will be Export registry file)

steps.title: Name the file regbackup.
steps.content: Name the file regbackup. Click save.

steps.title: Read to make sure it is a link to that program.
steps.content: Read to make sure it is a link to that program. Check this once the item is found.

steps.title: Continue pressing F3.
steps.content: Continue pressing F3. Delete all the items pertaining to the program, until all the links are gone.

steps.title: Reboot the Computer to Complete the Process.
steps.content: Reboot the Computer to Complete the Process.
